newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks end firmer, but market tiring.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks end firmer, but market tiring.

text.p: Madrid stocks ended firmer but off session highs, and while dealers remain bullish they warned that the market may need a rest in the short-run.
The general index closed 2.84 bps, 0.60 percent, higher to 477.59. The Ibex-35 index of leading shares gained 20.20 points, or 0.37 percent, to 5,490.43.
"Stocks are still strong but this afternoon we saw a tired and more volatile market. At this point a technical correction is possible, but I wouldn't expect anything too severe," one dealer said.
Trading volume remained high, with more than 100 billion pesetas changing hands.
Telefoncia again attracted much interest after it opened its 21 percent share offer and paid a 35 peseta gross dividend.
The telecommunications group rose 10 pesetas to end at 3,385, in heavy trade with turnover reaching 4.14 billion pesetas.
Among other stocks, Repsol added 40 pesetas to 5,920, while Endesa gained 80 pesetas to 10,160, and Iberdola was up 10 to 1,710.
BBV and Banesto also ended higher, gaining more than 1.8 percent.
